Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: PB2775
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to go to a concert at the Paradiso music venue (just 2 minutes walk from the hotel). The staff were very helpful, the room was comfortable and clean. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Ramona2121 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A simple hotel in a great location. We stayed for 4 nights and had a great time. The stairs were steep but I would guess that most hotels in the area would have stairs like that. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was fine. I would stay there again next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and friendly/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AEDoxsey
Reviews.Content: Got back yesterday after 2 nights at the hotel. Stayed in room 202 at the front of the hotel. We arrived before check in time and the lady at the reception kindly let us leave our bags whilst we went sight seeing. The other 3 members of staff we met at reception were equally friendly and helpful. On the plus side this hotel is in a great location for the museums, restaurants and bars. The room was clean and tidy and reasonably spacious with plenty of wardrobe space and a hairdryer. It was -10 outside but the room was very warm, infact too warm for my partner. There was plenty of hot water in the shower which had good pressure. We had breakfast on both mornings which worked out at 5 euros per breakfast. If you only had breakfast on one morning it is more expensive. The breakfast was a cold buffet with meats, cheeses, smoked salmon, bread, hard boiled eggs, toast , fruit juice, fruit, tea and coffee. For the price it was a perfectly acceptable start to the day. On the down side, the staircase upto the rooms is very steep, but only what you would expect in the small hotels in Amsterdam. The bathroom floor is marble and was very cold and no bath mat was provided. I welcome addition would have been a tea/coffee making facilities in the room. This was our first visit to the hotel and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Cancelled without reason”
Reviews.Author: shutb45
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel through their website. About a couple days later I got an email from the hotel saying that the reservation had been cancelled with "due to the following reason: as requested from Mr. Ed". I sent them several emails asking them to confirm that room reservation has indeed been cancelled and the reason for it being cancelled. I have not received any response. Hopefully my credit card will not be charged on the day that I was supposed to have arrived. Too bad I would have loved to have tried this hotel considering how close it is to the main museums.

Reviews.Title: “certainly not art gallery,”
Reviews.Author: cheeqy
Reviews.Content: clean and comfortable, and great location, but a little imagination to the decor would have been nice plain white walls throughout made it rather drab, over priced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Very good...”
Reviews.Author: Max_la_menace
Reviews.Content: Smiling and helpful team. Silencious and comfortable rooms. Hotel is just between the museumplein, with the rijkmuseum, vangogh museum, the vondelpark and the heineken brewery, and leidseplein, where you can find anything you want to eat. My stay has been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, but for the money, I'd expected a bit more”
Reviews.Author: Outintheblue
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, less than 5 mins walk from Leidseplein and from there you take tram 1,2 or 5 to the central station in 10-15 mins. The Hotel itself is a a nice, clean place and the staff is very friendly. But one minute after check-out time, the cleaner knocks on your door!! The bathroom is simple but clean and sufficient. Small stairs indeed, but do-able. In the end you only carry your luggage twice, so it's do-able. It is however an old building, so nearby closed doors and upstairs walking you will hear. But only three rooms shared our hallway, so not much people walked by. But for the money I paid, I did expect a bit more... But overall I didn't regret it and I would go here again (if they lower their prices a bit ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Girafje
Reviews.Content: We can't wait to come back!!! Till next time in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter020081
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay in this hotel. The hotel is perfect located in between the big museums and the outgoing area (Leidseplein, big bars, clubs etc.). The hotel is cosy, they have little rooms in the lower areas. But also big, rooms higher up in the hotel. For this price you are perfecty located in a very old, Amsterdamish place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 1table
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 2 nights in this hotel and it was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. When we arrived, the sheets and bathroom were dirty (hair in the sheets and dirty kleenex and urine smell in bathroom) and we could barely fit our luggage into the room. We booked a double bed and were given two single beds with no explanation or apology when we mentioned this to reception. The staff was extremely rude and were not helpful when we asked them for directions or advice. The room was in the basement where you can hear everything through the thin walls, especially the guests and staff in the breakfast room. To top off this horrible experience, they accused us of eating breakfast when we checked out (which we didn't eat) I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.....DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “WE had fun”
Reviews.Author: nikikli
Reviews.Content: GReat location. Close to the centre. Next to Volderpark. Mediocre rooms. Excellent breakfast in a cozy basement. Great staff

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, until they accused me of stealing a blanket.”
Reviews.Author: niina
Reviews.Content: Personally I found the location good as there were numerous clubs, restaurants and stores very close to the hotel. The railway station was a bit far, but not an impossible distance away. The rooms were extremely small, we had difficulties fitting out luggage in, and the bathroom door could not be properly opened because of the bed. However, we didn't see this as a big minus, as we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. I would have wished for the rooms to be cleaned, however. The breakfast was ok, the breakfast room could have been a lot bigger though. The staff was very nice and helpful, and all in all we were definitely happy with the hotel, until our departure. On our departure day we checked out of the room but left our luggage to the hotel as our flight was to leave only later and we wanted to still go walk around the area. When we came back, we were told that there was a problem, following by the manager blaming us for stealing a blanket from one of the beds. We were shocked to say the least, and convinced that there had been a mistake. As we did not confess to the crime we were accused of (we definitely had no reason or need to steal a blanket), the manager threatened to call the police. As it was only a blanket and we did not want to miss our flight because of it, we had to pay 40 euros for a blanket we did not steal. Other than this incident, I was happy with the hotel, but definitely don't recommend it to anyone, as I do not want anyone else to be blamed for stealing.

Reviews.Title: “Art Gallery Hotel - All you need in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LMCinVB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Amsterdam only 2 nights, booking through Travel Bound a package for hotel and breakfast in Leidseplein area, which couldn't have been more perfect for my needs. The hotel was conveniently located only across the canal from the Rijksmuseum, 3 blocks from the Leidseplein Square, also the Interliner #370 bus got me from Schiphol to the square area in under 40 minutes and for only $4 euro - as well it was a short jaunt from this bus stop & tram stops at the square, so it was super easy to take trams #2 or #5 to Centraal and Damrak. The night auditor, Ramses, was super accomodating and highly entertaining, his impressions of the Godfather left me in stitches. My room, a single located on the 2nd floor, was behind an extra doorway and through a very dark short hall, I felt rather like "Ann Frank", staying behind a cupboard, and this tended to make my short Amsterdam stay even more atmospheric. The room was all I needed as I was not 'in' much, the bathroom was only just past my 'cupboard' entryway and was clean & neat as a pin. The entire hotel was neat, smallish and very European in every way; breakfast buffet was ample and the nook in the lower basement area was simply perfect! From this location I could easily walk to the square, where as I said, trams and buses could take you anywhere easily, also nearby was a canal tour pick-up point, only 1/2 block from the hotel. I went to Boom Chicago, at the Leidsepleintheatre, and thoroughly enjoyed their Improv Show as well as the friendly staff. I also easily and cheaply rented a bike (Mac Bike) only 2 blocks from hotel and was able to cover entire Vondelpark, AlbertCuypstraat and other areas handily. The 100-highlight Holland International canal tour was GREAT. I will enjoy staying at Art Gallery Hotel again and hope to visit some museums on the next tour, when I'll be sure to book an entire WEEK!

Reviews.Title: “Art Gallery Hotel, Amsterdam a good place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: monica m
Reviews.Content: I've been stayed at Art Gallery Hotel from the 18th to the 22nd of November with my husband and a couple of friends with a 6years child. The strategic position of this Hotel and the buffet-breakfast are two very interesting key-points, the Hotel is a two stars of category (in Italy it'd be a three probably) , we stayed at the top floor, room quite large and confortable (with bathroom), not noisy. The Hotel doesn't have a lift so you have to "climb" stairs. The breakfast is served at the lower floor, good and "large" with many things to eat both sweet and salty, you can have coffee in great quantity. The staff is really friendly and kind.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: pfiddle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a budget-hotel "The Art Gallery" on Weteringschans opposite the Rijksmuseum. Very good value at â‚¬75,- for a decent doom en-suite with breakfast. The receptionist Mohammed was the sort of person EVERY accommodation should have. Truly an excellent ambassador for any establishment. He was the very personae of help, charm, attentive to detail that makes staying there a feeling of security and well-being. The hotel is a very typical Amsterdam building one like many I've painted during my 12yrs running a repair and decorating company in Amsterdam. It has small steep narrow staircases and many Europeans to say nothing of N. Americans would baulk at the stairs, however for those on a budget and for younger travellers I can't recommend the Art Gallery (0031 (0)503175510) highly enough. 100 meters from Rijksmuseum with the van Gogh and the Stadelijk behind that - also the Concertgebouw Concert Hall. Right behind the hotel is old Amsterdam with all one would ever want from it. To the right (East) is Liedseplein and to the left and south in the biggest street market in Europe - Albert Cuype - where I lived in the early 80's. Great place to walk , check out the goods (mostly clothes now) and people and sample all the different (World) cuisine. A great hotel in a great city with buckets of ambiance. Say Hi to Mohammed for me.

Reviews.Title: “One to give a miss!”
Reviews.Author: budoka55
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend break. First the good points: The hotel is reasonably near the centre of things; quite busy, convenient for transport and not too far from the major attractions. The buffet continental breakfast was very acceptable. On the more extensive negtaive side, it is the other side of the city centre from the central station (which is good for getting to and from the airport), which did cause a little extra cost and inconvenience. The hotel itself is only ten years old but shows its age; I suspect it has never been refurbished. The breakfast room is very small (only 4 tables) and becomes congested. I think the occupancy rate is not high as I was upgraded from a 'small double' to a rather misnamed 'delux' room: the double bed consisted of two singles pushed together with separate duvets for each. The flush button on the toilet was broken so that you had to use a finger nail to press the plastic stub to flush the toilet and the shower has the habit of going from warm to scalding hot rather rapidly. I did wonder what my non-delux room would have been like! A major inconvenience was that there seems to be no routine cleaning of occupied rooms! Reception informed us that rooms were not entered except when guests checked out! We were only given this information when we queried why our room has not been cleaned, bed(s) made, bins emptied or towels replaced. This despite information and notices in the room saying to leave dirty towels on the bathroom floor if they are to be replaced (the receptionist informed me that towels are only replaced on request and didn't seem to recognise this contradiction). This is the only hotel I have ever stayed in where rooms are not routinely serviced and towels replaced. Overall, for the quite expensive price (though I think its cheap by Amsterdam standards!) this was disappointing stay and one I will never repeat.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FoteiniM
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and kind staff, esp. the manager very good breakfast and facilities cosy atmosphere internet connection practically next to the museums and in a nice quiet area very close to Leidseplein where all the bars and restaurants are. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Conned”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays63
Reviews.Content: we were not expecting a great hotel something cheep warm clean and comfortable but was very disappointed. firstly we went out and done a littlle sight seeing beautiful , came back to the room for a lie down and the room was freezing a large window and short curtains we asked to have the heating on reception said we always have people complaining about this room and then offered us a room on the third or forth floor my goodness you had to be a mountaineer to climb the stairs it was like a ladder with carpet straight up we only managed a few rungs as it was really unsafe after another chat with reception he said there was nothing he could do about this and proceeded to charge us for one night stay reluctantly i paid 65 euros silly of me i know but the receptionist threatened to call police as this was their policy unfortunately i was not told about this prior to booking and feel greatly disappointed we had to then spend more of our hard earned money to find somewhere else to stay maybe if his reveiw is read i might be reimbursed for my nonestay ill keep you posted if they do

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: pinkmartini_Istanbul
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning , 2 couples.The first thing we did was breakfast, I have to admit it was quite well in a really small dining place... The rooms were not ready so we left out for lunch and sightseeing, we came back in the late afternoon and after a tiring travel all the way up from Turkey and wandering around the city all day it was a real bad suprise we had when we got our rooms. One room was right next to the reception really small ( we knew we booked a small double room but we did not know it would be that small , no space even to a luggage) the other double room was even worse, it was a twin room right next to the dinning area with L shaped bed design, tiny and uncomfortable beds,The ad on hotels website said LCD tv but we only got an 15" really old TV and the furniture was all worn-out, the room looked totally unclean, dark and dingy, stinking and flooded bathroom, you need to flush down the toilet to remove the floating water after a shower and when you do that the water comes up from the shower drain on the floor. And they seem to know the situation of the shower/toilet because when we complained about the flood the first thing they did was to come down and flush down the toilet. The room was too cold, the heating seems broken or something, it was impossible to close the 2 windows (looking to the buildings aisle) in the room so the wind was coming in through the window it was not possible to use the bed next to the windows to sleep and they were fully aware of this situation as well but they could not care less. They couldnt offer us a better room even with the price change because they were fully booked. We had to search for another room in the city and had to move out to sleep somewhere decent... I am so sad I was so upset that I did not take the photos of the room we had while we were running out, they have really nice pictures in their own website... The only good thing is the location of the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere, Lovely views”
Reviews.Author: sbouckley
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior double room with great views of the Rembrant museum. About 2 minutes walk from tram line (No. 1,2,5 from Centraal Station). The hotel sends very comprehensive information once you have booked, and Ed the proprietor is very courteous, and helpful. He very kindly marked on the map, all the sights and attractions. Hotel is situated about 5 minutes from the canal cruise boats and about 30 minutes walk from Centraal Station, through all the best shopping streets!! Great room with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The hotel is spotlessly clean, well situated, however it would not be suited to those who are 'less able' as to get to the 4th floor there are some very steep winding stairs! As you would expect in Amsterdam. Breakfast included in price, very good. Really enjoyed our stay, would recommend this anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Place was awful, staff were worse”
Reviews.Author: Helen_HFL
Reviews.Content: I arrived alone at 10:30pm - the guy who checked me in was rude and unhelpful. I didn't feel at ease as a lone female traveller. I'd booked a double room, since my boyfriend was to join me the following night and it was just awful. The thing that really got me was that it wasn't clean at all. I don't mind small or dark but this was just dirty. The bathroom really stank (worse than public toilets) and when you showered the water just flowed out all over the bathroom floor. The hotel's response to the smell was just to spray air freshener in the bathroom. For over 100 EUR a night you could find a place that was at least clean. I would recommend anyone to stay away from this hotel, and not even risk getting one of the 'better' rooms. Helen

Reviews.Title: “Could have booked my own wardrobe, for free!”
Reviews.Author: stephp38
Reviews.Content: I can only offer comment on the room we were allocated and that on a five minute assessment, we went to another hotel. Room 101 (ring any bells UK tv watchers?) is ground floor and behind reception, the charge for our three day stay being Â£288.00, not what I would consider a budget price but okay as this was a "Boutique Hotel". Afraid not, yes the staff are really helpful and informative, but our room was little more than a cupboard, big enough for a double bed and bedside cabinet and not much else. Two windows look onto an internal 8 foot by 8 foot atrium above the breakfast room and service area, dank and dingy just about says it all. During out five minute stay every word spoken at reception could be heard and anyone going up or down the stairs sounded like they were coming into the room to join us. We were very dissapointed as the emails from the hotel were friendly and informative and the website paints a pretty picture. I may or may not get a refund for two of the nights but to be honest I don't care, it would have been a miserable place to stay and would have ruined the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Whats the problem ?”
Reviews.Author: John-Ball
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 night at the hotel. Though not as pretentious as its website suggests. Its Ok for Amsterdam. Its location is excellent, just accross from tne Galleries, near lots of cheap (thogh variable, but try the Tong-Ah in Leidsedwarsstraat for a great economy ricre table) and Leidesplein for trams and bars Staff are indeed helpful, no bag to room service (but what smarter hotel does these days) stairs steep but typical of these 19th century buildings, nothing like as bad as the budget favourites of Raadhuisstraat. Milder stairs also available. Room small and quite gloomy (typical Amsterdam), front might be sunny but trams, heating available 24 hours, ensuite roomy, fresh towels daily, "wet room" style as seen in many modern Dutch houses, with corner drain. Slight leak from cistern (clean water) good bed. Breakast very adequate, self service including tea/coffee. Not as well presented as smarter hotels but as good selection. Fresh fruit. Semi skimmed milk, fresh from carton, certainly not powdered !Tea coffee help yourself all day. Given the outrageous prices in Amsterdam these days, its a good, budget level hotel and should be seen as such. Would not reccomend for elderly guests (Im only 68) as stairs. If you want the Amsterdam experiece, stay somewhere like this, otherwise use a modern clone that could be anywhere, and will take all your sweety money !Will come again.

Reviews.Title: “One to Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having keenly viewed pictures of this hotel, I was expecting a relaxing 2/3 star hotel. This hotel barely scraped as a 1 star, the room was very small, extremely dark and pools of stagnant water collected in the bathroom. The breakfast was no better, cold mush of eggs and cereal with powdered milk. I was totally prepared for the different style of Dutch breakfasts and enjoyed many during my stay, this hotelâ€™s breakfast was truly awful. I left the hotel and ending up staying in the Hotel Dâ€™Amsterdam for 90 Euros a night which was of far higher quality. My advice â€“ avoid this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “not what it said...”
Reviews.Author: NikkiBrighton
Reviews.Content: when i saw the pictures in the brochure i was delighted with my choice, considering my partner and i just wanted a budget short break away from the stresses of the children and did'nt want to pay a huge amount. i happily booked a small double for a three night stay. on arrival at the Art Gallery my delight soon turned to disapointment, the reception staff were friendly but did not offer to show us to our room let alone help with the luggage ! what we did receive was a broken key card and a pointing finger to help us on our way ! stairs in the beautiful city of amsterdam are generally steep and rather lacking in depth but a hoist would have been more appropriate for transport to our room! after negociating this with no guide and our luggage in hand the initial disapointment turned to something else. the room description as a "small double" was something of an under statement! our "clean and comfortable" room was nothing of the sort. the low lit rather grimy apearence of the room/cupboard was further compounded by the "en-suite" bathroom. which had a distinct smell to it after a little investigation it was found that the stench was eminating from the showers drain, this was confirmed by the drain, a drain which bubbled every time the toilet was flushed !!!!!!!!!!!! so remember if you find yourself in an unexceptablel room go and complain straight away !!! "our german guests have the better rooms because they complain so much" "sorry" was the Art Gallerys line of defence!

HotelInfo.Name: Art Gallery Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Weteringschans 67, Amsterdam 1017 RX, The Netherlands
